title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 March 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:01 <qwebirc9461> anywhere in the manage gui that I can upload something?  
00:02 <qwebirc9461> I am not that familiar with tomcat  
00:05 <@sdumitriu> Not to the Tomcat management, to XWiki, but by accessing the 8080 port directly  
00:05 <qwebirc9461> ahh that's easier to test  
00:05 <qwebirc9461> hah... one second  
00:06 <qwebirc9461> yes - that worked immediately  
00:07 <@sdumitriu> So it is a configuration issue  
00:07 <qwebirc9461> well - that nicely narrows down my problem space at least =)  
00:07 <@sdumitriu> Unfortunately, I can't help with that, since I know almost nothing about NginX  
00:08 <qwebirc9461> haha - well, I appreciate the debug assist!  
00:08 <@sdumitriu> Try to /join #nginx  
00:08 <qwebirc9461> I'll have to start looking into someone deployed and working nginx config - I don't have any experience with it either  
00:08 <qwebirc9461> Thanks again  
00:09 <@sdumitriu> You're welcome  
00:09 <@sdumitriu> I hope you engoy XWiki so far  
00:09 <qwebirc9461> ya - it's going well. I'm about 1 day into researching wiki's in general for a small business intranet so I'm not ready to make much of a ruling yet =)  
00:10 <qwebirc9461> but I was sold enough on the dev version that I decided to go for a production install  
00:17 <polx> has quit  
00:19 <qwebirc9461> has left #xwiki  
00:21 <vmassol> has quit  
00:29 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:44 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:48 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
02:12 <qwebirc22998> has joined #xwiki  
02:18 <qwebirc22998> Hi All - I'm stuck trying to get debug logs from the LDAP integration. I've integrated the logging calls in the appropriate .xml file, but I don't seem to get anything regarding LDAP still. Anyone available to throw me pointers?  
02:30 <qwebirc22998> has quit  
02:42 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
03:17 <DrLou> has quit  
06:34 <vishnu> has joined #xwiki  
06:37 <vishnu> sdumitriu, hi  
06:37 <@sdumitriu> Hi vishnu  
06:37 <@sdumitriu> Any progress?  
06:38 <vishnu> :) ya definitely! I am learning xwiki!  
06:38 <vishnu> I mean, its interesting!  
06:39 <vishnu> I am trying to import xwiki-enterprise-ui-all-3.5.xar into my xwiki, since my initial database is empty.  
06:40 <vishnu> and it says, "Importing xwiki-enterprise-ui-all-3.5.xar: Error while preparing importing"  
06:40 <vishnu> is there a way I can know what the error is exactly?  
06:42 <@sdumitriu> Well, did you check the logs?  
06:43 <@sdumitriu> I don't remember seing that error before  
06:43 <vishnu> That is the first thing I did, but I did not find anything there  
06:44 <vishnu> ohh  
06:46 <@sdumitriu> At what step do you get the error?  
06:47 <vishnu> I clicked on "Administer space", upload the document and when I click on the "import", I am getting this error  
06:50 <@sdumitriu> Could you try to disable JavaScript in your browser and then try to import again?  
06:51 <vishnu> ya, ok  
06:59 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
07:00 <Denis> has quit  
07:04 <vishnu> sdumitriu, I got it! :)  
07:04 <vishnu> thank you so much :)  
07:05 <@sdumitriu> You're welcome  
07:05 <vishnu> that is so cool :) What was the problem actually?  
07:05 <@sdumitriu> No idea  
07:05 <vishnu> :D  
07:06 <@sdumitriu> But in case the AJAX call fails, there's a chance the non-JS UI will work  
07:06 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:18 <vishnu> has quit  
07:41 <faryshta> has quit  
07:54 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
08:00 <faryshta> has quit  
08:02 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <vmassol> good morning  
08:53 <vmassol> hmm seems we have a regression somewhere  
08:53 <vmassol> in master  
08:53 <vmassol> when I start a clean XE the My Modifications Panel is full of broken links  
08:53 <vmassol> sburjan`: could you verify you get this too?  
08:54 <vmassol> see https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/8qmtw/wiki-home-main.webhome-xwiki  
08:56 <polx> has quit  
08:58 <+sburjan`> i'll check when I get at the office  
08:58 <vmassol> ok thanks  
09:06 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <vmassol> seems the bot func tests is failing on master/platform, trying to reproduce, it's possible it's simply the code macro taking too long to execute the first time  
09:15 <vmassol> (more than 10 seconds!)  
09:17 <vmassol> nice timeline: http://timeline.verite.co/ Could you be a nice extension to use it and show changes in the wiki in a timeline (the details would be the diffs)  
09:25 <polx> has quit  
09:29 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:36 <polx> has quit  
09:41 <Jerome\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <Jerome\_\_> has quit  
09:54 <vishnu> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <vishnu> has quit  
09:56 <vishnu> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <vmassol> ok found the issue, fixing  
09:58 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <+sburjan> vmassol: downloading latest snapshot now  
10:07 <vmassol> ok  
10:16 <+Denis> vmassol: Good morning, I am still puzzled by your proposal about relative reference, could we do a short skype call (the one I missed yesterday), to get rid of this once for all ?  
10:17 <vmassol> Denis: it's both Thomas and my proposal, we did it together :)  
10:17 <vmassol> yes but not right now, I need to do something first  
10:17 <vmassol> can we do it at 11:30?  
10:17 <+Denis> let me know when, I am really more available today, I am really sorry for yesterday  
10:18 <vmassol> np  
10:18 <+Denis> yes fine  
10:19 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <Denis> has quit  
10:35 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <+tmortagne> I guys, i'm about to commit a last thing (XWIKI-7670) and should be ready to start the release  
10:36 <+tmortagne> any new blocker found ?  
10:40 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r5807797 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/58077979184e3e7a57477a8ee1a6ac2982b9715b / (4 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7670: Make class references always local - http://git.io/DNWLNQ  
10:41 <+tmortagne> looks like all the test jobs have failures on jenkins...  
10:41 <polx> has quit  
10:51 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <polx> has quit  
10:54 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm working on fixing the ircbot func tests for platofrm  
11:04 <vmassol> something has changed somewhere that's causing it to fail now  
11:04 <vmassol> I can reproduce locally, trying to find out what has changed  
11:05 <vmassol> also it seems we have a regression in the "my modification pane"  
11:05 <vishnu> has quit  
11:06 <+sburjan> vmassol: yes indeed, recent modifications is broken even in a vanilla xwiki  
11:07 <+sburjan> I see sope API exposed in the link, dunno what could cause it.  
11:07 <vmassol> I see this issue too on an empty wiki: https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/8qcnw/xwiki-main-webhome  
11:07 <vmassol> it wasn't there before  
11:08 <vmassol> my guess is that a change in a vm was done recently  
11:08 <vmassol> might be eddy  
11:09 <vmassol> removing spam  
11:10 <vmassol> done  
11:13 <vmassol> found it  
11:14 <vmassol> done by Denis/Andreas  
11:14 <vmassol> fixing  
11:14 <+sburjan> wondering how only that panel is broken  
11:17 <vmassol> done by AndreasJonsson actually in his last commit  
11:17 <vmassol> fixing  
11:21 <vmassol> Denis: what's the jira issue for the new rights module?  
11:21 <vmassol> I don't see it in the merge commit but I'm sure that's caused by my inability to understand git/github  
11:22 <+Denis> XWIKI-5267  
11:22 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: you committed yesterday but without any reference to a ajira issue  
11:23 <vmassol> Denis: can you point me where it's specified in the merge you did?  
11:23 <vmassol> XWIKI-5267 is still open but we're releasing, shouldn't it be closed too?  
11:23 <+Denis> yep, you right, I forget to put the issue in the merge, but the last time I do so, the merge gets broken  
11:24 <vmassol> that's not a good reason :)  
11:24 <vmassol> for something as important as this it's not very good  
11:24 <vmassol> and AndreasJonsson continued yesterday to commit without jira :'(  
11:24 <+Denis> that is bad  
11:25 <+Denis> for the merge, you still have the branch, this is a clear indication  
11:25 <vmassol> er?  
11:25 <vmassol> if I go in jira  
11:26 <vmassol> and click the git tab I don't see it  
11:26 <vmassol> that's the point of specifying jira issues in commits  
11:26 <+Denis> no it wont, by the way I am not sure all goes in jira anyway  
11:26 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* rb2edc3e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b2edc3e10bb9f897d0c2a198aba6237aa68366a4 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/xwikivars.vm : XWIKI-5267: New right service implementation ...  
11:26 <vmassol> they all go  
11:26 <vmassol> it's just that it may need to eb refreshed  
11:26 <vmassol> since xwiki sas split the jira  
11:26 <vmassol> but they'll all be there  
11:26 <vmassol> there's no magic ;)  
11:27 <vmassol> if the commit contains an jira id they are in the tab  
11:28 <+Denis> would be nice to be able to edit log message in git  
11:28 <vmassol> yes that's a feature we've lost  
11:29 <vmassol> it can be done but you need to rebase which is bad  
11:29 <vmassol> maybe we can do it here, I don't really understand the consequences of rebasing something that has been pushe  
11:29 <vmassol> pushed  
11:30 <+Denis> I thougt I had seen something about notes, and maybe a way to do so, I will try to  check this again, for sure rebase is not appropriate  
11:31 <vmassol> it's easy to do  
11:31 <vmassol> that's not the issue  
11:32 <vmassol> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/179123/how-do-i-edit-an-incorrect-commit-message-in-git  
11:32 <vmassol> but here has not pushed  
11:32 <vmassol> "For those somewhat new to git: Laurie's point about having not yet pushed is important. Like rebasing, this is changing the history. If someone has cloned/pulled from your repo between the original and rewritten history then they won't be able to pull after the rewrite (for that branch)."  
11:32 <vmassol> so AFAIU this means that eveyrone needs to git clone again, right?  
11:35 <+Denis> vmassol: it is over 11:30, Thomas is available as well  
11:36 <vmassol> I haven't finished fixing the tests though  
11:36 <vmassol> ok let's do it now and I'll finish the broken build after  
11:44 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r7cbbb88 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/7cbbb880c8228f9ddb2214771061de4dbd075c41 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Stop using the deprecated currentmixed/reference resolver (moved to legacy module). ...  
12:23 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <+tmortagne> guys there is lots of failing test and we are one week late for the release, we really need everyone to look at what they can and at least determine what's wrong ASAP  
12:40 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:41 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <+mflorea> tmortagne: some of the test failures were caused because the xe used doesn't package the legacy modules and the model script service was still using a legacy resolver, see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/7cbbb880c8228f9ddb2214771061de4dbd075c41 . This should fix most of the tests (I checked wysiwyg, ui and selenium)  
12:47 <+tmortagne> mflorea: ok  
12:52 <+mflorea> platform build takes 30min more on agent-2 than on agent-1. It's ~1h:30min on agent-2 vs. ~1h on agent-1. Is the power difference between agent-1 and 2 that big?  
13:02 <+mflorea> agent-1 has indeed a more powerful CPU (and 3 cores vs. 2 cores on agent-2) and more RAM  
13:26 <vmassol> mflorea: why do you say that "xe doesn't paclage the legacy modules"?  
13:27 <vmassol> \*package  
13:27 <+mflorea> vmassol: because it doesn't  
13:27 <vmassol> I don't understand  
13:27 <vmassol> we've always packaged legacy modules  
13:28 <+mflorea> I did a mvn -U clean install -DskipTests in xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg and the downloaded xe didn't have the legacy modules  
13:28 <vmassol> yes that's normal  
13:28 <vishnu> has joined #xwiki  
13:28 <vmassol> becuase you didn't use -Pci  
13:28 <+mflorea> no, I didn't build XE  
13:29 <vmassol> same  
13:29 <CIA-120> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) master \* r69c2e8a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/69c2e8a8b296cdbe708a21c0aac35f76005f4c9b / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/table/livetable.css : XWIKI-7672: Livetable's filter input's border-color should be consistent with the border color used for other form elements ...  
13:29 <vmassol> if you don't use -Pci then you won't get the legacy modules  
13:29 <+mflorea> vmassol: the xe zip is on maven, do you mean we have two zips, one with legacy and one without?  
13:30 <vmassol> we have a single one but all the code built on jenkins is executed with -Pci  
13:30 <vmassol> from commons to func tests  
13:30 <+mflorea> I'm telling you that the zip downloaded from maven.xwiki.org this morning didn't have the legacy modules  
13:31 <vmassol> you make is sound like it's normal  
13:31 <vmassol> which it defniitely isn't!!!!  
13:31 <CIA-120> Ecaterina Moraru (Valica) stable-3.5.x \* rb94388d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b94388dd7a66d4b13889f722f0636413ba2e19b0 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/table/livetable.css : XWIKI-7672: Livetable's filter input's border-color should be consistent with the border color used for other form elements ...  
13:31 <vmassol> also I don't understand how your commit changes anything  
13:32 <+mflorea> my commit makes sure that the no-legacy distribution works  
13:32 <vmassol> yes but I don't understand why it wasn't working  
13:32 <vmassol> since the code was compiling  
13:33 <+mflorea> because of a missing legacy component  
13:33 <+mflorea> so a runtime exception  
13:33 <vmassol> there was  even a unit test  
13:33 <vmassol> I'm curious to know why our tests didn't ctch this  
13:35 <+mflorea> the unit tests were using an explicit hint, "default/reference", while the runtime exception was caused by "currentmixed/reference". But it should have been the same.  
13:35 <+mflorea> wait  
13:36 <+mflorea> the tests don't lookup the resolver  
13:36 <vmassol> ok that makes sense  
13:36 <+mflorea> i.e. a mock CM is used  
13:36 <vmassol> one last question  
13:36 <vmassol> why did you keep this:  
13:37 <vmassol>                 // Make sure backward compatibility is preserved.  
13:37 <vmassol>                  allowing(mockComponentManager).lookup(DocumentReferenceResolver.class, "invalid");  
13:37 <vmassol>                  will(throwException(new ComponentLookupException("error")));  
13:37 <+mflorea> if you look in createDocumentReference, you'll see that I perform 2 lookups  
13:38 <+mflorea> in some particular case  
13:38 <vmassol> I'm definitely missing something  
13:39 <+mflorea> the problem is that some scripts might be using an explicit hint like "foo/reference" where foo is local, currentmixed, etc.  
13:39 <polx> has quit  
13:39 <vmassol> ok I see  
13:39 <+mflorea> so to preserve backward compatibility with these scripts, first I'm using lookupComponent and then lookup  
13:40 <vmassol> so indeed everywhere we expose hints to the user for resolvers/serializer we need a bridge  
13:40 <+mflorea> yep  
13:41 <+mflorea> well, at least were we know we had the type specified in the hint  
13:41 <vmassol> ok now I need to understand why legacy modules are not paclaged in xE on jenkins  
13:41 <vmassol> I tested this locally and it was working when I committed it  
13:41 <florinciu> has quit  
13:42 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <evalica> has quit  
13:44 <vmassol> finishing fixing platform first  
13:46 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <vmassol> apparently your commit fixed the ircbot mflorea :)  
13:57 <vmassol> (not sure why though)  
13:57 <+mflorea> cool :)  
13:57 <vmassol> (or maybe it was my commit but not sure why either)  
13:57 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1724/  
13:57 <vmassol> (we both committed)  
13:59 <+sburjan> release is postponed for monday ?  
14:01 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <+tmortagne> sburjan: no yet  
14:06 <+tmortagne> not  
14:07 <+tmortagne> there is still some time if we can stabilize jenkins  
14:07 <+tmortagne> but I guess it will probably not be much more that maven/git release  
14:17 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r420f364 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/420f364a2b31f29313a4ed909ba4dc6e58e6e272 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java : XWIKI-7670: Make class references always local - http://git.io/nIDgGw  
14:18 <+sburjan> question: do we have any mail agent setup on our jenkins agent ? I wonder for Invitation Application tests don't fail on our agents, because for me it fails locally on Windows, and I dunno if it's and OS issue or I miss something in my system which fails the test  
14:19 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
14:19 <+sburjan> do we actually send and e-mail when testing Invitation App ?  
14:19 <+mflorea> I'd check if they pass on Linux  
14:20 <+sburjan> checking now  
14:21 <jvdrean> has quit  
14:22 <@cjd> yes, the test does send email, it configures greenmail as a faux mail server to catch the mail and verify that it is what it's supposed to be.  
14:23 <+sburjan> splendid :)  
14:23 <+sburjan> now, could you tell me how can I configure a faux mail server on a windows machine ? Don't know how to do it on Linux either :)  
14:24 <+sburjan> not familiar with greenmail  
14:24 <@cjd> it's done as part of the test, you might want to check your firewall in case it blocks data from being sent to itself.  
14:25 <+sburjan> so it's already configured within tests-ui in enterprise ?  
14:25 <vmassol> ok so indeed there's a bug in the packaing  
14:25 <@cjd> yeah, you can see more about how it's setup n the test itself, you might be able to get some insite using wireshark  
14:25 <vmassol> the legacy modules are not included on jenkins  
14:25 <vmassol> checking  
14:27 <vmassol> ok the reason is simple :)  
14:27 <vmassol> the ci profile is not set in the jenkins job  
14:27 <vmassol> fixing  
14:27 <vmassol> done  
14:27 <vmassol> next build should be ok  
14:28 <@cjd> nice that the test failures were relitively limited  
14:28 <vishnu> has quit  
14:28 <+sburjan> ok, so they all pass on Linux, meaning there is something faulty related to windows  
14:28 <+sburjan> thanks cjd, another test which will be excluded  
14:28 <@cjd> check the firewall and try running wireshark  
14:29 <@cjd> I suspect it's a simple problem which is fixable  
14:29 <vmassol> it's a pity that xe job is waiting in the queue....  
14:30 <vmassol> when there are 4 agents free  
14:30 <vmassol> why is agent1 offline btw?  
14:30 <vmassol> ah no the reason is because platform is building  
14:31 <vmassol> mflorea: your fix fixed the NPE ?  
14:31 <vmassol> for ex: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1123/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui/CopyPageTest/testCopyPage/  
14:32 <+mflorea> yes  
14:32 <vmassol> ok cool  
14:32 <vmassol> do you know if all tests now pass when when don't bundle the legacy modules?  
14:33 <+mflorea> don't know if all, but I checked most of the ones that were failing and they were passing after my fix. There might be other places that are still relying on legacy code too though  
14:33 <vmassol> it's pretty easy to test btw: 1) modify enterprise job en remove -Pci 2) manually trigger job to execute 3) trigger the functional tests and hceck results 4) put back -Pci  
14:37 <+mflorea> tmortagne: maybe we should put agent-1 back online to speed up the build until we stabilize Jenkins  
14:37 <+tmortagne> mflorea: right I forgot  
14:37 <+tmortagne> doing it  
14:38 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <polx> has quit  
14:52 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <polx> has quit  
15:09 <+sburjan> vmassol: re out IgnoreBrowser annotations, I am using these 2 regex for excluding tests on IE8. Are you ok with the regex expressions ? @IgnoreBrowser(value = "internet.\*", version = "8\\.\*")  
15:12 <+sburjan> tmortagne: there is something strange with our last snapshot, I get a stacktrace when accessing the XE for the first time, also I see stack traces when running tests, but they are not related to the actual tests: 2012-03-30 16:13:21,447 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/commentadd/TestSpace/TestComments] WARN  c.x.x.o.BaseCollection         - Absolute XClass reference including a wiki reference (xwiki) used for an XObject class reference. The reference has  
15:12 <+sburjan> been changed to relative.  
15:12 <+sburjan> java.lang.Throwable: null  
15:12 <+sburjan>         at com.xpn.xwiki.objects.BaseCollection.setXClassReference(BaseCollection.java:208) [xwiki-platform-oldcore-4.0-20120330.102957-203.jar:na]  
15:13 <+sburjan> afaik there is a discussion on devlist about it, I think we broke something
